Key Match Events: The Kings came back in the last few minutes to pull a win out instead of losing.
They had some really bad turnovers on basic passes.
Doug gave some effort defensively, and only played because Kevin was really bad and Keegan was hurt.
Post-Match Reflections: The team needs positive play to help build confidence.
The roster is too wonky and flawed, they are too inconsistent and Monte will fail to rebalance the roster in a meaningful way.
The season is too far gone.
It was a good sign that they were able to pull out a win against a depleted team.
It was a positive to win one!
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings have the 7th best point differential (+1.3) in the Western Conference but sit in 12th place, 4 games under.500.
The Lakers, with their -2.4 point differential are 4 games over.500 and in 7th place.
The Kings have been swept by the Lakers this season.
The average number of fouls called on the Kings in those 4 games is 21.25 vs 15.5 for the Lakers.
The Kings are 14.75 for 19 from the stripe, while the Lakers are 21.5 for 27.
The Kings have three players in the leagueâ€™s top 30 for FTAs: Fox (12th), DDR (20th) and Sabonis (29th).
Others: The crowd was energetic and gave the 76ers pressure.
Malik's energy was felt by the team.
The Kings need front court depth.
Alex Len looked out of his element.
The team needs to be better on the bench.
The Kings have a huge 3P problem.
The Kings are -8.4ppg from beyond the arc, -0.2ppg from the line.
The difference at the arc is massive.
The three point line must be the city limits for Copenhagen.
